page.title: 01Upper Nidderdale N Yorks
page.content: Two small villages and small valley farms make this a pleasant tourist area though not in the National park nor an area of outstanding natural beauty. Todays visitors come on foot along many of the paths (including the new Nidderdale Way) cycle or by car. The railway closed in 1929 and the track removed in 1936 and the land taken back by the farmers but the route is clearly visible. A regular bus service is, except in summer, virtually a thing of the past. There ae several campsites, bed and breakfast and hotel accommodation but the youth hostel closed in 1983. The land rises severly from the Nidd and becomes poor. Only for sheep,grouse rearing and timber lofthouse houses some of the water board workers buy. There are no lead miners.
